intro: Draba heterocoma, commonly known as the alpine whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple and appear in early spring. Draba heterocoma is characterized by its low-growing habit and its ability to survive in harsh, high-altitude habitats.
